content:
34. ‘You shall not tempt the Lord your God.’ To which 
temptation did Jesus give this reply? 
A. Bowing down to the devil 
B. Turning stone into bread 
C. Jumping from the pinnacle 
D. breaking his long fast. 
 
35. Which of these parables teaches about judgement and 
separation?  
A. The Dragnet B. The Hidden Treasure 
C. The Sower D. The Leaven 
 
36. ‘If anyone would be first, he must be last of all and 
servant of all’. What does this saying of Jesus teach? 
A. Endurance B. Lack of ambition 
C.   Humility D. Relaxation. 
 
37. The appearance of Elijah and Moses at the 
transfiguration indicates the significance of the 
A. prophets and apostles 
B. prophets and the law 
C. Spirit and the word 
D. Kings and the judges 
 
38. One of the illustrations of Jesus on true greatness is 
A. giving alms to the poor 
B. preaaching the gospel 
C. becomig like a child 
D. knowing how to pray. 
 
39. From which town did Jesus send two of his diciples to 
make adequate preparation for the last entry into 
Jerusalem? 
A. Bethphage B. Golgotha 
C. Jericho D. Bethany 
40. Which religious groups asked Jesus about payment of 
taxes to Ceasar? 
A. Pharisees and Sadducces. 
B. Pharisees and Herodians 
C. Sadduccees and Herodians 
D. Herodians and Zealots. 
41. When the Pharisees accused Jesus’ disciples of 
plucking heeds of grain on the Sabbath, Jesus reffered 
them to what David did during the high priesthood of 
A. Nathan B. Zadok C. Ahimelech D. Abiathar. 
42. ‘Take heed and beware of the leaven Pharisees and 
Sadducees.’ This leaven is their 
A. wealth B. hypocrisy C. wisdom D. teaching. 
 
43. The three thousand converts on the day of Pentecost 
devoted themselves to 
A. breaking of bread and the prayers 
B. speaking in tongues 
C. healing and preaching 
D. prophesying.  
 
44. Two of the seven deacons are 
A. Paramenas and Proselytus 
B. Simon and Stephen 
C. Nicanor and Nicolas 
D. Prochorus and Protus. 
 
45. According to the apostle’s speech before the 
Sanhedrin, the holy Spirit is given by God to 
A. the followers of Christ 
B. the disciples of Jesus 
C. those who obey God 
D. those who fast and pray. 
 
46. In his speech concerning the replacement of Judas 
Iscariot, Peter quoted from 
A. Isaiah B. Jeremiah C. Joel D. the Psalms. 
 
47. When Peter escaped from prison during the passover, 
the guards were 
A. drunk B. struck dead C. transfixed D. fast asleep. 
 
48. One of the seven Hellenists who preached the gospel 
in Samaria, and from Azotus to the Syrian capital, 
Caesarea, was 
A. Stephen B. Prochorus C. Nicanor D. Philip. 
 
49. Simon the magician was rebuked by Peter in Samaria 
because he 
A. perverted the minds of the people 
B. opposed the teaching of the apostles 
C. Wanted to purchase spiritual power with 
money 
D. refused to be baptized. 
50. The disciples were for the first time called Christians in 
A. Tarsus B. Antioch C. Jerusalem D. Judea. 
  CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE 1989  
 
1. ‘Then the Lord God said, “It is not good that the man 
should be alone;…” 
A. Assistant  B. Woman 
C. Helper D. Companion 
 
2.  The first generation of mankind was destroyed in the great 
flood of water because of 
A. corruption and violence 
B. disobedience to the Torah 
C. worship of idols 
D. immoral sex relationships. 
 
3.  Which of the following is the sign of the covenant between 
God and Abraham? 
A. The sprinking of blood on door posts 
B. Going to Jerusalem every year. 
C. Keeping of the Passover 
D. Circumcision in the flesh of the foreskins. 
 
4. God appeared to Jacob in a dream and Jacob made a vow to 
A. return to his father’s house 
B. furnish the house of God 
C. make Bethel his new home 
D. pay tithe to God. 
 
5. Joseph sawhis sale byhis brothers as God’s plan to enable him. 
A. revenge on his brothers 
B. become the lord of Egypt 
C. become a father to Pharoah 
D. preserve life.
